<jobs>
    <job>
        <title><![CDATA[Warehouse Technician - Will Call Counter]]></title>
        <description><![CDATA[
  
Position Summary
  

  
This position receives, stores and distributes material, tools, equipment, and products within the warehouse, ensuring accuracy and timeliness of all job functions.
  

  
Essential Responsibilities, includes but are not limited to 
  

  

  
+ Assist with shipping and receiving, unloading trucks, checking in merchandise, matching purchase orders to sales orders and distributing to associates for processing
  

  
+ Read customer orders, work orders, shipping orders or requisitions to determine items to be moved, gathered or distributed and/or shipped
  

  
+ Move materials and items from receiving or storage areas to shipping or to other designated areas
  

  
+ Sort and place materials or items on racks, shelves or in bins according to predetermined sequence such as vendor, size, type, style, color or product code
  

  
+ Fill requisitions, work orders or requests for materials, tools or other stock items and distribute items to shipping or to designated route driver storage area
  

  
+ Ensure warehouse is accessible and safe for salespeople and customer traffic
  

  
+ Assemble customer orders from stock and place orders on pallets or shelves, or relocate orders to a holding area or shipping department
  

  
+ Mark materials with identifying information using appropriate method
  

  
+ Open bales, crates and other containers
  

  
+ Record amounts of materials or items received or distributed via appropriate computer program
  

  
+ Assist in counting of physical inventory accurately
  

  
+ Weigh and count items for distribution within plant to ensure conformance to company standards
  

  
+ May be assigned facilities maintenance duties as needed
  

  
+ Complete requisition forms to order supplies from other departments
  

  
+ Prepare parcels for mailing that are compliant with local, federal and international requirements
  

  
+ Sweep, dust, mop and organize warehouse and work area for orderliness at all times
  

  
+ Wear the proper safety equipment
  

  

  

  
+ Additional duties as assigned.
  

  

  
SAFER Competencies  
  

  

  
+ Sincere and Committed to Customer Service & Safety
  

  
+ Accurate and Productive to Support Quality
  

  
+ Fearlessly Ethical, Fair and Consistent to ensure Organizational Integrity and Safety Compliance 
  

  
+ Empowered to support engaged growth by ensuring team collaboration, development and motivation
  

  
+ Ready & Urgent Subject Matter Leader
  

  

  
Qualifications
  

  

  
+ Minimum of a High School Diploma or GED Equivalent
  

  
+ Minimum three years industrial or retail warehouse experience
  

  
+ Previous shipping and receiving experience preferred 
  

  
+ Previous warehouse computer software experience. 
  

  

  
Physical Demands 
  

  
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. 
  

  
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
  

  

  
+ While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and hear. This position is very active and requires standing, walking, bending, kneeling, stooping, crouching, and climbing all day. The employee must frequently lift and/or move items over 50 pounds.
  

  
+ The work environment is an open-air warehouse where equal to or greater than outside ambient air temperatures can be experienced.
  

  
+ The effective utilization of a computer system and face-to-face conversations to exchange information with internal and external customers is required on a daily basis.
  

  

  
Position Type/Expected Hours of Work
  

  
This is a full-time, direct hire position. Overtime or weekend hours may be needed. 
  

  
 
  

  
 Equal Opportunity Employment  
  

  
We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities. We recognize each individual’s potential to offer significant contributions to our organization’s growth and stability.
  

  
 
  

  
E-Verify
  

  
This Employer participates in E-Verify.
  

  
Powered by JazzHR

    </job>
    <job>
        <title><![CDATA[Apprentice - CDL Driver]]></title>
        <description><![CDATA[
  
Essential Responsibilities, includes but are not limited to 
  

  

  
+ Provides timely delivery and pick-up to and from designated customer locations of customer equipment, breathing air, and/or bottle trailers.
  

  
+ Provide courteous customer relations and always strive to strengthen Company. relationship with the customers by establishing a reputation for fast, accurate, and on-time deliveries.
  

  
+ Perform additional duties in the Operations Department by being trained in “Breathing Air Technology” with primary emphasis on operating breathing air compressors to fill all types of air cylinders and safely deliver to the customer in accordance with approved Company Operating Procedures.
  

  
+ Serve as an Air Shop Technician, when directed, performing receipt inspection, cleaning, servicing, reassembling, and testing of customer equipment in accordance with approved testing and service procedures.
  

  
+ Continuously strive to upgrade skills and capabilities to be able to handle new assignments and responsibilities consistent with company needs.
  

  
+ Understand that all personnel involved in Field Services assignments are both authorized and obligated to refuse to perform any task they deem unsafe, and to immediately report such an incident(s) to management
  

  
+ Respond immediately and with a sense of urgency to work requests from the Operations Dispatcher
  

  
+ Comply with all applicable DOT regulations and inspect all equipment for damage and/or excessive wear when picking up equipment. Report findings to the Operations Dispatcher
  

  
+ Other duties as assigned
  

  

  
SAFER Competencies  
  

  

  
+ Sincere and Committed to Customer Service & Safety
  

  
+ Accurate and Productive to Support Quality
  

  
+ Fearlessly Ethical, Fair and Consistent to ensure Organizational Integrity and Safety Compliance 
  

  
+ Empowered to support engaged growth by ensuring team collaboration, development and motivation
  

  
+ Ready & Urgent Subject Matter Leader
  

  

  
Qualifications
  

  

  
+ Minimum of a High School Diploma or GED equivalent
  

  
+ Willingness and ability to receive a Class A CDL License and hazmat endorsements within 90 days of hire.
  

  
+ Valid TWIC card required. Current Medical Card preferred.
  

  
+ Must be the age of 23 or older.
  

  
+ Must be able to enter client sites without restrictions.
  

  
+ Minimum of 90 days driving experience.
  

  
+ Exposure servicing SCBA/SAR respiratory equipment & Breathing Air Filling procedures preferred.
  

  
+ Fork Lift Operator (Desirable)
  

  
+ Willingness and ability to work on-call – weekend and nights
  

  

  
Physical Demands 
  

  
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. 
  

  
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
  

  

  
+ While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to sit and stand; reach with hands and arms; stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl use hands to finger, handle, or feel; and talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to walk.
  

  
+ The employee is frequently required to climb or balance. The employee must regularly lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. Must be able to regularly push and/or pull 110 pounds (wheeled rack).
  

  

  
Position Type/Expected Hours of Work
  

  
This is a full-time, direct hire position. Overtime or weekend hours may be needed. Rotating on-call schedule to include weekends required.  
  

  
Travel
  

  
Local Client Site Delivery
  

  
 
  

  
 Equal Opportunity Employment  
  

  
We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities. We recognize each individual’s potential to offer significant contributions to our organization’s growth and stability.
  

  
 
  

  
E-Verify
  

  
This Employer participates in E-Verify.

        <title><![CDATA[Licensed Fire Technician]]><
